sections.text:
## Nester is a community of like-minded investors (our Nesters)
Are you seeking an investment secured on property?
- We are FCA authorised and regulated.
- We are ethical, transparent, and adhere to socially compliant principles.
- We are FCA authorised and regulated.
- We are led by security and our technology has cutting edge encryption and data security

sections.title: Request more Information
sections.description: Investment products shouldn’t be restricted to the elite, we create a transparent environment for you to learn and invest. We focus on property because it’s what we know best. Technology now allows us to put the power back in the hands of people.

sections.title: Why invest with Nester?
sections.subtitle: You can earn up to 9% p.a. secured against UK Property
sections.description: Nester offers investments ranging from commercial buy to let, refurbishment, and Bridge finance. Each varying in risk and return.

sections.title: What can you invest in?
sections.description:
Our financing criteria allows Nesters to invest in three core 
types of property financing arrangement offered to Buyers:

figures.title: Buy To Let
figures.description:
Commercial properties that are let to an unrelated tenant generating rental income for the Buyer. 
Buy to Let properties can include retail outlets, offices, dentists, warehouses, etc.

figures.title: Refurbishment / Light development
figures.description: Development or light refurbishment of residential or commercial properties. Residential properties are strictly not for the subsequent residence of the Buyer or any connected party.

figures.title: Bridging
figures.description: Bridge facilities allows the Buyer to utilise a quick financing arrangement for a short period of time, typically 12 months.

sections.title:
[blue]How it works then?[/blue]

This is Nester’s Deal Journey

figures.title:
Nester Receives 
Finance Application
figures.description: Buyers approach Nester seeking finance for a property acquisition, refurbishment, or refinance.

figures.title:
Application 
Screening
figures.description: All transactions are reviewed by a team of property professionals with decades experience and processed through a scorecard built with robust underwriting standards.

figures.title:
Credit
Committee
figures.description:
Once a deal has progressed through the screening process and is supported by a team member, it is presented to credit committee for approval. 
A further independent check and balance.

figures.title: Deal Live
figures.description: Once approved the deal goes live on the Nester platform and becomes available for approved investors to invest. Each deal summary includes the due diligence performed by the Nester team and documentation available to download.

sections.title: How we Review our Deals
sections.description:
We rigorously review all deals and the majority are rejected. We only select those that we would be comfortable in supporting. Our review, or due diligence, consider the numbers as well as the quality of the transaction.

These aspects and more are included in our assessment, a summary of which is presented to our Nesters to help you decide which opportunity to invest in.

cards.text:
### Credit Assessment
- A formal valuation of the property. 
- Analysis of Rent and strength of Tenants. Credit score from our service partner, **Credit Safe.**

### Quality
Experience and track record of the Buyer. 
Full demographic location analysis using ReAlyse Interrogate business plan and consider market outlook. We visit every property we offer.

### Security
All Investors in Nester arranged financings benefit from a security package that is managed in trust by Nester Security Trustee Ltd. This security will always include a first fixed legal charge over the property being financed, as well as other security depending.

sections.title: How  we measure our Risk Score
sections.description:
We’ve created a risk scoring algorithm further assist our investors. Results from the due 
diligence process are put into a scorecard that calculates a rating. There is a spectrum as 
summarised below with the lowest score reflecting the highest risk that Nester would 
support and the highest score reflecting a lower risk.

figures.title: Outstanding
figures.description: [bold]‘A’ rated[/bold] financings score highly in the majority of due diligence categories.

figures.title: Very Good
figures.description: [bold]‘B’ rated[/bold] financings score highly in some of the due diligence categories.

figures.title: Good
figures.description: [bold]‘C’ rated[/bold] financings meets Nester’s minimum financing criteria with few categories.

items.title: Who is Nester?
items.description: Nester was first established in 2018 and is based in London. We operate as an online peer to peer (P2P) financing platform which will help you discover and invest in new property opportunities as an Investor or even help you finance your property depending on your individual needs. We believe in providing ethical and easy to understand information to all our customers

sections.title: Why does Nester exist?
sections.subtitle: "To financially empower our community by offering a simple solution with security so that our Nesters take back control of their future and flourish."

sections.title: Our Team
sections.description:
The founders and senior management team have unrivaled experience and a proven track record in 
financial law, global banking, real estate financing and software architecture and design.

people.name: Youness Abidou
people.bio:
Mohammed is a partner and the Head of Islamic Finance in the Middle East at an international law firm.

As an industry authority, Mohammed has been recognised for his achievements in structuring Islamic Finance transactions in the UK real estate sector. He has worked extensively in structuring products and new start businesses (including establishing regulated institutions).

A highlight of Mohammed’s career was his time spent serving on the Bank of England’s Committee on Islamic Finance, which assisted the UK Government in establishing London as a global hub for Islamic Finance.

Mohammed is ranked as a Band 1 practitioner by Chambers Global
